intro: Bellevalia inconspicua, commonly known as the common bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, often found in meadows and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
